lust.question: Did I consider others' full humanity, or did I reduce them to their appearance, usefulness, or what they could do for me in my online interactions, social media connections, or conversations?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their blessings, privileges, or advantages?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others using language that was vulgar or hurtful?

prodigality.question: Have I recklessly squandered my resources, compromising my financial obligations and family needs through excessive gambling?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships, particularly during conflicts or disagreements?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage within myself, rather than seeking reconciliation, even when interactions with others have been frustrating or difficult?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

impurity.question: Did you use certain practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.
